strategy: Introduce a hierarchical attention mechanism within the CNN spatial encoder, where the first layer applies global spatial attention to identify key navigation regions (e.g., goal, obstacles, exit), followed by a finer-grained local attention layer that focuses on immediate surroundings. This allows the model to prioritize high-reward regions and reduce noise from irrelevant cells in the grid. The dynamic reward shaping function remains unchanged, but now incorporates a learned attention-weighted path cost that emphasizes efficient traversal through high-attention areas, improving convergence and path efficiency.
